topic.title: Setting Up a Floating License Server for

section.title: Determine if you need to set up a license server
section.p:
If you are using floating licenses for , you may need to set up a license server. If the computers that will be using the floating licenses are on different network segments, you must use an floating license server. A floating license server can be installed as one of the following:
A Java servlet.
A standalone process. version 17 or higher requires a license server version 17 or higher. License servers version 17 or higher can be used with any version of a floating license key.

section.title: Activating Floating License Keys
section.p: To help you comply with the EULA (terms of licensing), all floating licenses require activation. This means that the license key will be locked to a particular license server deployment and no multiple uses of the same license key are possible.
During the activation process, a code that uniquely identifies your license server deployment is sent to the servers, which in turn will sign the license key.

section.title: Split or combine license keys to work with your license servers

p.ph: A license server can only manage one license key (which can cover any number of floating licenses). If you have multiple license keys for the same version and you want to have all of them managed by the same server, or if you have a multiple-user floating license and you want to split it between two or more license servers, please contact support@oxygenxml.com and ask for a new license key.
